subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: Although the character itself is written with a slanting {{l|mul|丶}} dot in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}, the {{w|Ming (typefaces)|Ming typeface}} used in Japanese {{w|Kanji}}, Korean {{w|Hanja}} as well as the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}} uses a vertical dot for the upper component of <font size=5, lang=ja>[[亠#Translingual|亠]]</font> in most of its derived characters which is slightly different from modern Chinese scripts which uses a slanting {{l|mul|丶}} dot for the upper component of <font size=5, lang=zh>[[亠#Translingual|亠]]</font> in its derived characters.
